bug.author: PerspectivesLab
bug.description:
IMPORTANT: Please use the following template to report the bug. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Describe the bug F strings are not implemented for python 2.7, all demos working with F string for python 3.6 are not working To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
cd 'examples\Python\Advanced' python surface_reconstruction_poisson.py F strings are not implemented for python 2.7 => please change your documentation
Expected behavior surface_reconstruction_poisson.py should work with python 2.7 as specified in the docs Screenshots If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: [e.g. OSX Mojave, Ubuntu 16.04, Windows 10.0] Python version: Open3D version: Is this remote workstation?: yes or no How did you install Open3D?: pip or conda or build_from_source (provide build method, such as GCC, Xcode, Visual Studio, and so on)
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: Umm, I cannot see any f-strings in the aforementioned script. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/griegler>@griegler</denchmark-link> , could have you look?

No, I checked all the surface_reconstruction_*.py files and did not find any f-strings. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PerspectivesLab>@PerspectivesLab</denchmark-link> did you had another file in mind?
